Have we met before? Yes, I have an account No, I'm new here. Hi, there! Your name Let's get to know each other.
What's your name? Nice to meet you %s! Before we carry on, would you mind telling us your email address. (Don't worry we won't use it to spam your inbox. We just need it to set up your account.) email Great! We love meeting new people! We hope that by using this app, you will be able to balance your habits, even the bad ones, to have a more productive and stress free life. What time do you prefer having your first meal of the day?(i.e. breakfast) What time do you prefer having your second meal of the day? And what time do you prefer having your third meal of the day? I don't have second meal of the day. (Finish) I don't have third meal of the day. (Finish) Thank you! Log in password And what time do you prefer to wake up? Welcome to pyhie %s! Next Few more things We just need to ask you a couple of questions about your daily routine.
What time do you prefer going to bed? (You will be able to change or add more times later.)
You probably heard the term “Top one percent”, it usually refers to the most wealthy people in our society. Now using this app will most likely not get you to be one of the wealthiest people in your society. But you could still be in the top one percent of most effective, stress free or successful people, and it’s not that hard.

 How? Well study after study showed that people with regular sleeping and eating patterns are less prone to stress, they are getting less tired and in general have more energy throughout the day. On top of that people who keep and follow a daily planner are more organised and more effective at what they do, and same goes for people who regularly clean and organise their living area.

 Did you know that only 22% of people in the United Kingdom sleep in regular patterns, less than 10% monitor their sleep times. Only about 28% of people have their food at the same time every day. About 18% clean and organise their living area regularly and about 10% keep a daily planner. So in total only about 1% - 2% of people will do all these things at the same time, and it is very likely that these people are the most effective and stress free around us.

 So by simply organising these simple activities into your daily habits, will put you into the “Top one percent”.
Unfortunately you missed deadline for this habit. - 10 points Back Consistency is a key to success. This is why you are required to complete your main habits daily, each main habit should be completed before midnight.
 Failure to do so will results in losing 10 points for each habit that you missed. Don't forget you can add more sleeps to your sleeping habit, if you like having a nap in the afternoon :) (Don't forget you need to submit main habits every day before midnight in order to avoid penalty points.) Be in the top one percent. Daily advice Let sleep by your ally, not enemy. We spend one third of our lives asleep, it is a major indicator of our well being. Having a good night's sleep is essential to your health, same as a healthy diet and exercise. 

On the other hand, having irregular sleeping patterns could cause sleep deprivation on a daily basis. When a person is deprived of sleep, he will get tired more quickly and will have difficulty maintaining focus. Your brain will recognize this as a dangerous behaviour, and will send stress signals to his body, making you even more prone to anxiety and stress attacks. 

It has been proven many times that people who wake up and go to bed at the same time are more confident and less prone to stress and fatigue.
We are what we eat. Our well being is directly linked to what we consume. It is not a secret to anyone that consuming good food is essential for our health. But in our daily lives it can be difficult to keep track of what we eat, this is why it is good to develop your own eating schedule. 

Consuming and digesting food is a difficult and complex process, having food at the same time every day will get our body more efficient at getting through this process. It is like a sort of training, when we do things at the time our body is expecting to do it, it will do it more efficiently. 

Maintaining healthy eating habits will help you be more energetic and less prone to stress.
Forgot password? Enter your email reset your password Back to main menu You Reached Level %d! My Account Notifications Name:
Hello blank fragment Quality:
These are the activities that you are required to complete each day. You will be awarded points for completing each habit, the maximum amount of points you can receive for each habit is ten. 
Please remember not completing these habits before midnight will result in losing points!
These are the optional activities that you can activate, if you have the right level. As these activities are optional you will not lose points for not completing them. But you will earn points for completing them. 
Each activity will start at level one, the more you progress within the activity the more points you will earn. Good and Bad Habits In order to complete this activity, simply enter when you went to bed and when you woke up and how you slept. The closer you are to your preferred time and the better you sleep the more points you will get (max. 10). In order to complete this activity, simply enter the times you had your meals. It is up to you to decide how healthy your food is. The healthier you eat and the closer your actual meal time is to the preferred one, the more points you will get (max. 10) This one is straight forward the cleaner and more organised your living space is, the more points you will get. (max. 10) In order to complete this activity, you must first enter the required amount of activities for tomorrow's planner. Then mark off all the activities that you completed today and press submit. The more activities you complete the more points you will get. (max 10)
